thread.title: Anderson Silva added to UFC 208 in Brooklyn
thread.title_full: Anderson Silva added to UFC 208 in Brooklyn

author: Mike Johnston
title: Anderson Silva added to UFC 208 in Brooklyn
text:
Anderson Silva added to UFC 208 in Brooklyn 
Anderson Silva (David Becker/AP) January 13, 2017, 7:10 PM Mike Johnston January 13, 2017, 7:10 PM 
Anderson Silva is set to return to the Octagon at UFC 208 in February. 
The former champion is dropped back-to-back unanimous decisions to current middleweight titleholder Michael Bisping and light-heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier in 2016. Silva’s last recorded victory was in 2012. 
He’ll face No. 8-ranked middleweight contender Derek Brunson at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn, N.Y. Brunson (16–4) had a five-fight winning streak snapped by Robert Whittaker in November. 
UFC president Dana White made the announcement on Twitter Friday evening. Anderson "The Spider" Silva vs Derek Brunson #UFC208 in Brooklyn. pic.twitter.com/wvCVA9utTi 
— Dana White (@danawhite) January 13, 2017 
Silva's addition adds some much-needed star power to a card being criticized for its dearth of high-intrigue fights. 
Here's what UFC 208's tentative 14-fight lineup currently looks like:
